title: Hudski Dualist Pre-Order Opens Today
content:
First previewed in last year’s Sea Otter coverage, the all-new Hudski Dualist is a boost-spaced “big sibling” to the Hudski Doggler John reviewed back in 2023…

Hudski Bikes teased over the weekend that the pre-orders would open up today at 4 PM PST for the Dualist and we think the bike is going to sell out quickly. So, if you’re curious if the Dualist might be the jack of all trades for your stable, roll on over to our Sea Otter Reportage from last year to check out the updates and more photos. Find the pre-order info and frame specs below.

Hudski Bikes Dualist Pre-Order Quick Hits

  • Price: $2400 complete/$1400 frameset (frame/fork/headset/hardware)
  • Delivery: May/June
  • Preorders: March 3rd, 2025, 4:00 PST
  • Deposit to reserve: $600
  • Colors (above)

Updates vs. Doggler

  • More clearance: you can now easily run 29×2.4” tires for a true rigid MTB experience.
    Updated axle standard to Boost: the gold standard of axle standards, there are a huge selection of aftermarket wheel options available
  • Frame adjustability: Dial in your set up for your riding style. Two-position flip-chip for fork offset (44mm, 54mm), and two-position flip-chip for chainstay length (435mm, 450mm). Note: the Hudski Doggler has a static 44mm fork offset and 450mm chainstay lengths, a great “dirt surfer” geo
  • Chainring clearance: up to 38t chainring clearance with 52mm chainline chainring, stock with 32t chainring
    Internal cable routing: Through the frame, not through the headset. Makes dropper routing smooth and allows maximum tire/chainring clearance
  • Things to note: threaded BB, frame/fork tested for MTB use, threaded bosses, internal dropper cable routing, unique two-piece-welded forged BB, postmount brakes front and rear, UDH standard (transmission compatible in 450mm chainstay position only)

Dualist Geo and Specs

The Dualist is a proper rigid mountain bike with a tall stack, long reach, slack head angle, and a steeper seat angle compared to the Doggler. The bottom bracket drop is improved as well for those who ride longer cranks and like the way a higher BB rides.

Roll on over to Hudski Bikes today at 4 PM PST to pre-order the Dualist for $600.
